website_summaries.verdict: While it's an affordable kit with several impressive features, it also comes with some quality concerns and limitations.
pros: In addition to its metal workmanship and built-in clamp, you can use this jig as a stand-alone model or mount it to a bench
Kit includes a durable carrying case
cons: Kit includes a few less items than others on our list
Though easy to use, inaccurate measurements are common
Drill bits aren't as tough as the other pieces

customer_reviews.title: This pockethole drill is easy to use and much more affordable than its competitors
customer_reviews.text: This pockethole drill is easy to use and much more affordable than its competitors. I was able to make a sturdy table using nothing but 2xs and pockethole screws. I'm very pleased with this unit. The kit comes with screws, but you'll need to buy longer ones if you have any bigger projects like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Simple jig kit with made with a cheap milling machine using cheap aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Simple jig kit with made with a cheap milling machine using cheap aluminum. You get what you pay for. I didn’t expect Kreg quality.. didn’t want to pay for it. I did a quick test after I opened it up because I read before I purchased that the bit broke on some’s first pass. Mine did not. I did however end up with aluminum shaving from the jig itself, which is verification of poor milling resolution of a cheap machine. Still usable and will use. See my attached pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the kreg at a much lower price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having tried pocket holes with the kreg mini jig. This kit is pretty much the same as the larger kreg jig but is all metal. Having used both: They're the same thing, this is just as good. I can't really speak to the hardware quality (Screws) because I just use the real kreg screws...
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Great little pocket jig
customer_reviews.text: Great little pocket jig!!! I was skeptical but yet I got this and it works pretty good. I centered one hole over center of 2x4 and drilled the 2 holes, then shifted it to other side centering the hole on cater and punching 3rd hole, so 3 screws across a 2x4. Pretty simple, may not have other adjustments of more expensive jigs, but the price was great!
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for... It works, but the bit doesn't fit well into the jig so you get metal shavings everywhere. Also, like many others have stated here, the drill bit broke while drilling my 5th pocket hole of the day. Better off keeping your money and investing in a Kreg jig instead.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Clem

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick stock
customer_reviews.text: Great product if you know what you are doing. Ideal to be used with 3/4" stock - if you try to use it with thicker boards, the holes will be off center. The screws in the kit I resceived are 1" not 1.25" as described, and are more appropriate for use with 0.5" stock. The clamping screw is 1/4" - looks a bit flimzy but does the job. I do own one of simpler Kreg jigs, with drill that became a bit dull, and have plenty of longer screws, so it is not a problem. Now I will be able to work much faster with 3/4" stock and I have got second bit - both for very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir

customer_reviews.title: Thicker pieces like 2x material need to have the pocket hole started ...
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't as expensive as the other options but I wound up buying one of the others because there is no adjustment to change where the hole starts in the work piece. Thicker pieces like 2x material need to have the pocket hole started further from the edge. No way to do this on this one. There are more flexible jigs out there that would prove more useful. I didn't return because I can see using it in specific situations but I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Spend Your Money On A Kreg Jig
customer_reviews.text: Grandpa always said be weary of generic brand tools -- our house grew up on old school Craftsman. I bought this for the price bargain, and so when you give little price, you get little quality. The bit has not broken on me yet, as I've read in many other reviews, however I've only made about 10 holes with my tool. The problem I have is the depth on the hole IN the wood. When I screw my pocket hole screws in, they stick out, not creating a flat surface. It doesn't make a deep enough hole. Also, the bit does not make a clean hole. Tears up the wood...very disappointed, but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kellyd8421

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money
customer_reviews.text: I own this and the first time I used it I discovered it would not work on 2X4's or any thin thicker than a one-by..... I now have the Harbor Freight unit and it is 100% better...
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Miller

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little tool. It's not Kreg quality, but it gets the job done well enough. It's excellent quality for the price, but don't expect too much from it. I've read other reviews where they're upset that it's not better quality. It's aluminum and under $30. Be realistic in your expectations. For small projects it's amazing. I used it to make new drawers for a project I'm restoring. I'm very happy with the purchase. Would recommend for other amateur hobbyists.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Second to Kreg!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love my EZ Pro pocket hole jig! I use it mostly for 2 by stock. Saves the wear on my Kreg which I mostly use for thinner wood stock.
customer_reviews.author: Papawolf

customer_reviews.title: Delivered rusty
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure it works as advertised. But to get a factory sealed package with rust already on it, doesn’t bode well for the quality of the product. In fairness, I did not contact the company before writing this, so I’m sure they may make this right, but I needed this for a project ASAP, and am afraid to use it due to poor craftsmanship out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brand

customer_reviews.title: Cheap tool buy Kreg instead
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cheap version of a kreg jig because I wasn’t sure if I would like the tool for my project. The way this is setup is pretty much for thin boards and they don’t tell you that. Drilling pocket holes into a 2x4 allowed glued and screwed boards to rip apart. I spent the extra money for a kreg k4 jig set and it’s way better for 2x4 applications. This cheaper jig didn’t work very well on my 1x4 either
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Howard

customer_reviews.title: Pocket holes cant be adjusted
customer_reviews.text: The pocket holes can't be adjusted to anything. That is the reason why it works so terribly. Every piece of stock you use will have its holes drilled in the exact same location, exact same depth, and the exact same angle- good for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Tarun Grover

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT WASTE THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: IT DOS"NT HAVE A DEPTH SETTING FOR THE THICKNESS OF THE WOOD . TRIED A 2X4 DID"NT WORK WELL AT ALL !!!!!!!!! WOULD NOT WASTE THE MONEY . GET A KREG JIG !!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy B.

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable cheap option for low-end projects
customer_reviews.text: Techno works. A good price for a mid-low end product. The two pilot Holes are not aligned so one hole ends up offset by 3mm. Also, as is obvious from the photos, you cannot make the holes farther away from the end of the board than the aluminum bar allows. This is an issue in projects where you need longer tongue and groove overlaps. No big deal, but I would definitely not recommend this for finish carpentry where the placement or alignment of the holes is extremely important. Otherwise, it functions perfectly. Drill bores and stops where needed, clamp holds correctly, etc
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Frey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality basic kit
customer_reviews.text: I liked the all metal construction and overall quality of all of the components. It's very easy to use and the built in clamp is helpful. If you only use pocket holes occasionally, like me, this is a great kit. This has nothing to do with the jig, but keep in mind, , but you also need to clamp your pieces when screwing together to prevent drift, as is the case with any pockethole joinery. Which, to me, doesn't save you much time over other joinery methods, like dowels.
customer_reviews.author: Carljp

customer_reviews.title: Usable but not made to last
customer_reviews.text: This seemed decent at first but it is definitely cheap. The set screw on the stop collar stripped immediately without even tightening it, i dont think it was tapped right or the aluminum is super soft. I think this set is ok for someone who rarely drills pocket holes but to be completely honest by the time i go buy a stop collar and im sure a new drill bit soon i could have bought a Kreg cheaper. I would recommend just spending the few extra bucks and getting the Kreg to begin with, it wll save money and frustration in the long run if you plan on using this very often.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Stenger

customer_reviews.title: Good Jig for the cost
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, this is not a bad Jig at all. The bits are of a lower quality to the more expensive kits out there and as a result the holes are not as clean and do require a bit of clean up to be presentable. All in all it does make a good back up or first time user/novice/hobbyist jig. I would not recommend for professional woodworkers. Over all for under $30 it's a great little jig and I would recommend it for a DIY user.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A complete package!
customer_reviews.text: This unit contains everything you need to get started. And once you do, it works like a champ. I agree with the instructions though, that you should "practice" on a piece of scrap first but in the end it takes only one or two practice cuts to get it right. No big deal. I loved using it as I built screen frames using 1"X3" furring strips for my porch. Mosquito free because of this little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it's not as fancy as some of the other pocket hole jigs, but it also doesn't cost the ridiculous amount of money those jigs cost. If you don't drill pocket holes all day, every day, then this is definitely the tool for you. It is priced right, and is seriously good quality, and easy to use. I went through 500 pocket screws filling the holes I drilled with this jig, and it was truly a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kreg can suck it.
customer_reviews.text: Quarter the cost and just as effective. Personally I perfer the screw clamp to. The clamp keg uses often will send things flying releasing it. Did pocket wholes for wainscoting panels and this was perfect. Spread everything up gave me perfect squares. Did like 50 slats in 30 mins. If u need pocket wholes and plan on doing a project that requires alot of repetition with pocket wholes. It's a must have. Cut time down in half
customer_reviews.author: Jack of all Trades!

customer_reviews.title: Great jig, works as described
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time owning a pocket hole jig and it has worked beautifully for one of my projects. I made a set of drawers to go in the bed of my pickup truck. I made approximately 100 to 120 pocket holes and this thing has held up beautifully. Based on the appearance, I don't know if the bolt that clamps the wood onto the jig will last a long time, but so far, it's held up alright. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Overrated garbage
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the positive reviews at all. This jig is junk. If I wasn't outside my 30 day window when I went to use it, I would have returned it. One of the two holes is clearly off angle, and proceeds through incorrectly. Further the allegedly 1.25" screws are very clearly only 1". I practically ruined a nice piece of oak catching this problem and had to do 2 more cuts to salvage my board and project, going back to my trusty Kreg. Do not want your money. Perhaps it's just variable results and some of these are made right, but mine is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Blanco71

customer_reviews.title: Does not do what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be an affordable alternative to the expensive Kreg since I don't use it much. The holes are not deep enough so when you drive the screws in, they stick up beyond the surface of the board (see photo). The drill bit when placed into the jig shows the depth is not correct. Even with the collar adjusted the depth is not correct. The drill bit chews out metal from the jig itself. It's such a waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Pascoe

customer_reviews.title: Blow out of one edge, had to return
customer_reviews.text: I made sure the bit was at full speed when the cut began. Just a poor design in manufacturing, a hole to let dust exit is too big thusly taking the edge away to stop blow out along the edge. I can not be this first one to have this problem, tool works but leave shredded wood fibers along each hole that have to be cut with utility knife. I have cheap one hole jig, tried drill bit with it worked fine. It is poorly designed, until that is changed it will not work properly. Everything else was great, make the sawdust exit hole smaller and you are great.
customer_reviews.author: Camy Klink

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Bit broke after a couple dozen holes. Super cheap! Technically works OK. However the allen wrench they include to tighten the stop ring on the bit is not the right size and stripped itself out when i tried to tighten it down. I had to go find another allen key to tighten it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you plan to use in on anything thicker than 1/2 or 3/4 inches
customer_reviews.text: The problem is, the position of the holes are fixed (because the jig is not open, any wood can only go to the end of the base plate). If you use it on a 2x4 the holes will be very near the edge and you will not have a strong joint. Best for cabinetry work and nothing else. If I can cut off the base plate, then it could be used for thicker wood. Unfortunately I did not open it before I was ready to make my worktables, and the return window passed.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Came exactly as promised. This kit had everything I needed to cut the perfect pockethole for a fraction of the price of the leading competitors brand!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: A great product to start off with. I didn't want to spend too much money on a Kreg jig right away and then purchase a clamp also. I like to that it comes with one built in. The plastic on the clamp doesn't feel the most durable. So far everything is great and I will update this review if anything takes place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made very cheap of poor quality metels
customer_reviews.text: For Accuracy: It says "Heavy duty". NOT! After a single use the set screw on the drill bit stripped. Very poorly made. Hopefully nothing else breaks before I get through this project. The screws that come with it are too short as well, however the extra package of screws I bought are of proper length, and hold much better.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelTK

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job, needs a sharp bit.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I don’t give five stars, the bit that came with mine was dull as a post, other than that easy to use, clamps good, holds good, alignment is good. Works as well as the more expensive jigs I’ve used. They only need to find someone who can sharpen their bits. I like mine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's not a Kreg, but it's does the job
customer_reviews.text: I've used a Kreg Jig before and they are amazing, but I didn't want to spend a lot of money for random building projects I'll do around the house. This tool worked great after playing around with it for a bit and remembering what do to! Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HayBay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old used this to make the pocket holes for a standing planter. It moved a little with drilling but not enough to affect how well the holes looked. We were very pleased. We had never made pocket holes before and it worked great. One star off for the wiggles.
customer_reviews.author: short stuff

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but works.
customer_reviews.text: Worked out well for me and easy enough to use, but dang it is built cheap. If you want something to last a while probably look elsewhere but if you just need for one or two projects it works. Be sure to set it up right the first time so you don't have to redo every hole like me.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G.

customer_reviews.title: Can not adjust the entry point of the holes
customer_reviews.text: I only used this on 2x4s. This pocket hold jig does not allow me to adjust the entry point of the woods and the holes are too close to the edge. It works when I clamp the two pieces real good with two clamps, at the connection spot and the to keep it connected. It’s still a good jig, just need some work to get the job done correction
customer_reviews.author: Nick Tu

customer_reviews.title: Good pocket-hole jig.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pocket hole jig. I'm quite pleased with the results. This was very easy to use. There's no plastic. And, it was extremely accurate. I did not have any problems with the drill bit that comes in the kit (other people had noted some issues, which made me a little hesitant to purchase it). If you don't mind the mess of powdered graphite, I found it helpful to coat interior of the jig with graphite to minimize drill bit friction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to use, but
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy. Attaches to a piece of wood (or a bench top). Is easy to use. Great addition to my carpentry tools. I am a 67 year old woman novice carpenter! Used this to make drawers and cabinet doors. March 2020 the screw that holds the wood in place...can't tighten it anymore because the hole it screws into is stripped,, so disappointed in this tool now.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Kreg
customer_reviews.text: I should have spent the extra money and bought a Kreg . Metal was covering one of the holes which I had to drill through before I could even use it . Not mamufactured properly .Pocket holes come out terrible. Shreds the wood . It is not clean at all .
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Decent Starter set for Pocket Holes
customer_reviews.text: I have made quit a few projects with this pocket hole jig. It works real well for what it offers, though it is obviously limited in it's capacity both for the size of a piece of wood, and for spacing of the holes. The included screws are pretty garbage though. The pocket holes are the right size for Kreg screws so consider picking some up. It's a great starter jig if you aren't willing to spend the money on a Kreg because you are unsure if pocket holes are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ryver Otter

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Tried to make a table for my table saw. 4x4's and 2x4's. I used the jig in the 4x4 and it was very week. Maybe the screws were wrong size. It was just week. Directions were not clear. Great concept, but maybe my application was too heavy for the product
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: One trick pony
customer_reviews.text: Seems to only be good for 1 inch boards as it cannot be adjusted . The angle is wrong for 1/2 or 1/4 inch and the height does not work for 2 inch. Drill bit is pretty dull, screws that came with the kit will not bite. It's a one trick pony.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for about a month, then the tightening screw slips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for daily use and it worked beautifully for the first month. The tightening screw slips and won't tighten. I returned it, right before the time limit. I received a new one and the same thing happened, but this time it was after Amazon's time limit. I'm bummed because it's a great device for a great price. I would recommend this pocket hole jig to those who do light woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: Needs 1 1/4” Screws
customer_reviews.text: The 1inch screws that come with the kit are too short. I recommend 1 1/4” screws. The holes made are not close enough to the edge of the wood. I had to put a 1/8” spacer in the bottom of the jig to slightly elevate the wood. I did not have any issue of the it chewing into the aluminum like others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Parallax2099

customer_reviews.title: Works but low quality
customer_reviews.text: I used it to make some nightstands and a dresser. It worked but the aluminum jig is flimsy and moved when drilling and the bit isn't great. I was using poplar so it should of drilled just fine but the bit would need me to push down more then others. Overall it works so if you have a small project I'd recommend it
customer_reviews.author: eman

customer_reviews.title: A must have at the right price!
customer_reviews.text: This pocket hole jig is a great one in that it does what it says creating nice fits for tight joints, especially if you glue things as you do it! Take you time and practice as needed. Then enjoy using it as your efficiency speeds up and seeing the final pleasing results of your project being done properly and something you can be proud of.
customer_reviews.author: James Stratford

customer_reviews.title: Better than kreg?
customer_reviews.text: Cleaner cuts and works faster than kreg system. And a lot cheaper. The knob makes it easier to release the board and slide to the next spot for drilling. The drill guide only has one position so you don't have to make sure you have it set to the right depth for different size boards, like the kreg requires. I made about 40 holes before I realized I had the jig set to the wrong size. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Yungpadawon

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure The Collar Is Set Tight And Right
customer_reviews.text: Once you get it dialed in and get the collar tightened down well (the allen wrench might be a tiny bit small) it works like a charm. Great price! Makes good pocket joinery if you pay attention to the little details.
customer_reviews.author: amphibiac

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last!
customer_reviews.text: Plz don’t buy unless you want to buy a device again after about 200 uses. The aluminum device will strip out and make the jig harder and harder to use until it is useless. Now I have to purchase another jig. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I liked the service everything went well,and this was my first pocket hole,this for me is easy to use,great to use on any job,and a great price,compared to others and yes you could get a more expensive one,but this works well
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: if you do any kind of woodworking there are many ways to join wood like drawers. if you are not experienced enough to join, or just don't have all the tools needed for the various joining methods then a pocket screw sure makes and easy and strong joinery method.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Chacon

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best thing I've ever bought for woodworking! Saves so much time, and makes connections easy and professional looking. I have always had trouble with table legs, for example. Not anymore! I put together a queen size bed frame with this thing, and it made it a snap!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but worked
customer_reviews.text: Arrive on time easy to use luckily for what I wanted to do. Priced a bit above the value in my opinion I have used the big name brand in pocket hole jigs and this is not its equal but it did do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nah!
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the Kreg system, one of the guide inserts keeps catching on the drill bit. And comes out.
customer_reviews.author: john koen

customer_reviews.title: Good for small prjoects
customer_reviews.text: Used this to create pocket holes for my corn hole boards. The jig itself worked pretty well. Although the screws that come with the kit are worthless, they are not long enough and dont have enough bite to secure the wood at all. Just throw them away and use slighlty longer actual wood screws.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua1106

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and it works just fine
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers complain about the sturdiness, but it worked fine for me. I suppose if you are making pocket hole joints for a living, the more expensive Kreg set-up is for you, but if you might use this occasionally then this works great and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: John P Horning

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This jig is pretty OK for the price, only problem I had was the Allen wrench screw that tightens the stop on the drill bit got stripped the first time I tried using it and it won't let go, I'm stuck at that height, luckily i had set it to the right height so I can still use it but it's made of cheap materials..
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent. Great to get everything needed in one package. Built about 20 cabinets with this so far. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: BldgDr

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders in the beginning
customer_reviews.text: The product worked wonders in the beginning and once you get the hang of it you can go quickly. The down fall is after several holes are drilled the aluminum starts to come of with the drill even when working at the same angle every time and can cause problems with the holes being wrong or unusable. Luckily it only messed up 2 of the holes I was making before I figured out how to compensate for the problem. Not a totally bad product but will be buying different one for the next project.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: HIT THE “BUY NOW BUTTON”!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Get this. You were obviously looking for it. It’s metal. The other ones are plastic. I had this in my hands and was joking all sorts of wood together for projects.....BUY IT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for quite some time now. I've used it on so many projects I can't count. I have no complaints, just wish I would have realized awhile ago I could mount this to table or saw horses. If someone stole this I would buy another. I don't think it will ever break it's well made.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtywhite6

customer_reviews.title: Diappt
customer_reviews.text: I used it about 20 times to drill. And today the drill got snapped. I was drilling MDF board. Disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rorymachen

customer_reviews.title: Great jig for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'd say your money is well invested in this jig. It's a strong design and you get a few additions thrown in just for buying it, so I can't complain with its performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: Leonel Barreda

customer_reviews.title: Drills accurate
customer_reviews.text: I like the it drills coz it's pretty accurate and it will stop automatically in the end. The only thing I dont like is u can't sideways coz it wont fit. All in all, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Overall disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a cheaper option for my first pocket hole jig. Pocket holes were not deep enough to secure attached piece. Wood plugs were too large. Overall disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my project
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the price. Works almost as well as the expensive one just doesn’t have the additional depth setting. I have made several large projects utilizing this set with great success
customer_reviews.author: Sassy mom

customer_reviews.title: Does what you need for the money
customer_reviews.text: While this pocket jig is functional and made sturdy enough it lacks the features of the kreg pocket jig system but it is a good bit cheaper so depending on how much you need to do this will work but if you are going to be using it extensively you might want to spend the money on the kreg
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy it. Go for the kreg brand. This works but it has no details on adjust the stop collar on the bit so the pocket hole depth is not going to be close to what you want plus your always stuck having to clamp and u cant adjust for the thickness of the wood. Its crap. It's my first I've bought but you learn.
customer_reviews.author: Drippin.That.Gin.N.Juice

customer_reviews.title: Works okay but no adjustment
customer_reviews.text: It’s cost efficient but if you need to be able to adjust to various thicknesses this is not it. The screw clamp is not Eric isn’t either with no quick release on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for joining boards. Can't believe I almost purchased the popular brand for more than double the cost. This product will surprise most users.
customer_reviews.author: rsharp

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and also very accurate. After the first time I used it I could not believe I have gone this far in life not already owning one! Awesome seller very informative, they sent info from packaging to shipment!
customer_reviews.author: pleb

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, tip broke during second use
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a good buy but the pointed tip of the step drill broke off during use. That was just the second time I used it . I am Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ola

customer_reviews.title: Good for small projects but nothing larger than 2" boards
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a whim because it seemed to good to be true. It is :( The angel the drill is set is not adjustable and does not drill enough into the 2x4. This causes the board to snap and break when any pressure is put on it. The screw is just not angled enough. Guess I'll have to spend the dough to get a better jig.
customer_reviews.author: Some body

customer_reviews.title: Great jig, wish I had it sooner
customer_reviews.text: I used this dowel jig on 2 projects so far and it worked very well. I made a screen door and cabinet doors. The glue joints will never separate. Exactly what I needed for these 2 projects and others.
customer_reviews.author: T. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Wood pegs wont fill in pocket.
customer_reviews.text: The drill bit and vice with guide works pretty well. The downside is it doesnt drill the pocket hole deep enough for the wood pegs to fill in. No matter how you adjust it the wood pegs just wont work. But the tool is good. Way cheaper than kregg.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D

customer_reviews.title: Its work
customer_reviews.text: Its work but item is made with low quality material. Material list weight and unstable when holding wood. I returned to get a solid material one.
customer_reviews.author: Win

customer_reviews.title: Great jig, easy to use, wrong size bit
customer_reviews.text: I really like this jig. I've been wanting to get a kreg jig but the nice sets are $100 bucks. The biggest problem was that for some reason, the bit it came with is too big for the screws. How does that make any sense? The square bit was too big for the screw heads that this kit came with, and it was too big for every other size kreg screw I bought. Other than that, I really like the jig.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was ordered
customer_reviews.text: Am not a talented woodworker but I built my own mobile cart for the garage and used this to help attach some trim around the edges from the inside to make it look a little more professional. Easy to clamp on and use, being done from the underside i didn't use any of the dowel pegs to fill the holes but rest of the kit was a help.
customer_reviews.author: Delores Jean How

customer_reviews.title: Trash. Trash.
customer_reviews.text: Trash. The holes are not even one wasn’t even fully drilled through so the bit got chewed first time trying to use it. Save the money and get a quality version that isn’t such garbage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Caravello

customer_reviews.title: It is not as fancy but works well and I would recommend it to the occasional wood worker
customer_reviews.text: It is an economical alternative to the original. It is not as fancy but works well and I would recommend it to the occasional wood worker.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: This really cut down on time and made the projects more sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I have been building projects around the house and really needed one of these. These worked perfectly on some adirondack chairs, a table and a wall cabinet. This really cut down on time and made the projects more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Annie W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool buy it especially if your a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Perfection the tool it's sturdy I used press wood board witch it's cheaper and it it still drill perfect pocket holes with no chipping . Side note you can screw the tool to your craft table witch makes it hands free you get biginer to intermediate tool for a great price love it it
customer_reviews.author: esmel delgado

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Showed up today on time, but was missing the drill bit, the collar, and the allen key pieces. We will see ifthe replacement is better. Update: second order had everything! Easy to use but allows for over penetration on holes. Be careful and go slow. Great other than that!
customer_reviews.author: josh magee

customer_reviews.title: Great Pocket Hole Jig!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pocket hole jig. I have used it several times and it is super easy to use. It's a great value for the money and just as good as the more expensive jigs.
customer_reviews.author: J C in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: It secures well to the boards and works as it ...
customer_reviews.text: It secures well to the boards and works as it should. I eventually got a kreg jig as a present and use that instead because this jig won't adjust for depth or thickness, which is it's only big down side.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gates

customer_reviews.title: Works great but metal shavings from jig indicate it won't be accurate for very long.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to join some 2x4's and it worked as expected. Either the drill bit is very sharp or the jig metal is very soft because I noticed metal shavings from the jig metal in the wood dust.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: If you use a lot I’d buy the kreg
customer_reviews.text: It works but you get what you pay for. The holding device feels flimsy, but for once in a while use it I’ll do
customer_reviews.author: Jason Taub

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: Every home wood worker needs one of these. Easy to use. Pieces I build look so much better when you can hide the screws. I was amazed. No more biscuit cutting for me. The quality of this is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Nichols

customer_reviews.title: not happy - not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: This jig only fits one size of board. If you have a 2x you're out of luck. That's not indicated in the description. Plus the metal was not drilled out properly for the drill bit to fit. It fit on side but not the other. I should return it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Shops@Amazon

customer_reviews.title: broke after first project
customer_reviews.text: i bought it for a table i was building for my wife and right at the end it snapped and the bit broke 5/10
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Fleshman

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it because it’s not adjustable to what I need but it’s a great product and really good price
customer_reviews.author: Amanee Alosta

customer_reviews.title: Ok for thinner stock, not suitable for 2-by material
customer_reviews.text: Is probably fine for smaller stock, but even though it will fit a 2x4 the angle of the hole isn’t adjustable so the screws pop out very close to the edge of the material. Wouldn’t trust the strength of the joint with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K.

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price the only thing they don't tell you is when you get it the depth is not set correct but it's an easy fix even if you already drilled the holes
customer_reviews.author: DJ_LBR

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: A very good product. The only downside is the fact that it needs to be screwed into a work table. I tried it without it being screwed, and it worked just as well. I would definitely recommend this product, and a lot cheaper than it's Kreg counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: glezbaum

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for one thing...used it many times after!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this quite a lot since purchasing. I quickly went through the provided screws and bought more. I do wish that it could be a bit larger
customer_reviews.author: George Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, must have tool. Remodeling our home and having to redo some cabinets and has made all the difference in the world. Sped up the progress of the project. Incredibly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pibb

customer_reviews.title: Alternative to Kreg for 3/4 wood joinery
customer_reviews.text: I have a mini kreg jig, it is pain in the butt to use. I bought this kit on sale and the price is cheaper than my mini kerg jig. Since I use 3/4 boad most of the time, this kit suits my purpose. Now my job is lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: NJer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent tool.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work pretty good, but the allen wrench provided is terrible and caused the collar to slip. Use a real allen wrench and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to use, as in drilling the holes. The screws sent with this product are not long enough to even go through the hole created. I don’t know if my is faulty but it is far from great.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Rushmeyer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The drill bit worked great but the screw drill bit didn't last more than one screw before it stripped. I order a different bit to go with it and it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo G.

product_meta.title: General Tools 850 Heavy Duty, All-In-One Aluminum Pocket Hole Jig Kit, 76 Piece Set With Carrying Case
product_meta.description:
General Tools 850 Pocket Hole Jig kit includes the jig with a built-in clamp, a 3/8-inch bit, drill step, 6-inch square drive bit, 48 square drive self tapping screws, and 24 wooden pocket hole plugs all in a hard molded carrying case. Pocket hole joints are ideal for leg and rail connections, cabinet construction. sneaking screws into tight squeeze spots or fastening picture frame miters. GENERAL TOOLS - THE PRECISE TOOL FOR DOING THE JOB EXACTLY RIGHT. Offering over 1, 000 tools, we’re proud to provide tradesmen, craftsmen and DIYers around the world with a broad range of affordable, specific-purpose mechanical hand tools and precision measuring and inspection tools. For inquiries, please contact our Customer Service Department at 212-431-6100. We strive to provide our customers with 100% satisfaction. WORK SMARTER, MEASURE BETTER & BE MORE PRODUCTIVE WITH GENERAL TOOLS.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The pocket hole jig kit includes the jig with clamps, a 3/8-inch bit, drill step, 6-inch square drive bit, square drive self tapping screws, and wooden pocket hole plugs all in a hard molded carrying case. Pocket hole joints are ideal for leg and rail connections, cabinet construction. sneaking screws into tight squeeze spots or fastening picture frame miters.
feature_bullets: COMPLETE POCKET HOLE JIG SYSTEM - Jig kit includes: pocket hole jig with clamp, #32 3/8 In. Step Drill Bit (replaceable), 3/8 in. steel stop collar, Hex wrench 6 in. square drive bit, 24 coarse square drive screws, 24 fine square drive screws, 24 wooden pocket hole plugs, Hard plastic carrying case.

ACCURATE- this jig creates flush, corner and angle pocket hole joints for leg-and-rail connections, building face frame cabinets, sneaking screws into tight spots, and fastening picture frames with unlimited applications

EASY TO USE- DIYers and expert craftsmen turn to this jig kit to build their woodworking projects. First, use the jig to drill steeply pitched counter bores in one joint member; then, drive self-tapping screws (without pilot holes) into the other member
VERSATILE- built to be portable or bench mounted and designed with a built-in clamping system
